title: Jethro’s Advice to Moses
summary: Exodus 18 tells of Moses’ reunion with his father-in-law Jethro, who praises God for the deliverance from Egypt. Seeing Moses overwhelmed by judging the people alone, Jethro advises him to appoint capable men as leaders to share the burden.

faq.question: What was Jethro’s concern?
faq.answer: That Moses was doing too much by judging every case himself.

faq.question: What solution did Jethro propose?
faq.answer: To appoint trustworthy men over groups to judge smaller cases, and bring only the difficult ones to Moses.
